about_the_game:
Abulia is a clicker RPG and Visual Novel adventure that takes place on mind of a special girl that is trying to find herself in the world and struggling to understand our complex world.

Gameplay

You are trapped in your room, days and time will pass by and you need to escape before falling into madness. interact with the different elements inside to discover how to do it:

  • Bed: This will activate our protagonist's thoughts and dreams allowing you to choose among three options that will have different effects in stats, mood and mental gauge.

  • Computer: You can check the state of the outside world through our protagonist favorite websites.

  • Mental Battles: Depending on the decisions taken our protagonist will get mentally exhausted, once the gauge is filled she will have a MENTAL BREAKDOWN. This will turn into either memories to be collected or enter a battle against ghosts.

    In mental battles you can collect different skills using Empathy, your health is depleted when hit and your statistics and mood will affect the battle.

    If you lose against your inner demons you lose the game

  • Memories: Check the memories collected. There are up to 30.

Door: If you manage to take the door you will escape.

Features

  • 30 memories to unlock

  • 30 Thoughts to deal with in Mind mode

  • 30 Skills to collect and use in battle

  • 30 Ghosts to fight against

  • Different emotional states

  • Events on PC with madness progression

Story
Carla has been trapped for who knows how many days inside her room, one day she wakes up and finds a huge eye that watches over. Worse than that, her room's door now seems to be cursed.

Find out her inner struggles while you play!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: SteamOS 3.0 or any 64-bit Linux distribution
  • Processor: Dual-core from Intel or AMD at 2.0 GHz
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.3 capable GPU or higher
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Sound Card: ALSA or PulseAudio-compatible sound card
  • Additional Notes: Ensure necessary 64-bit libraries are installed.
